verses.verse: Do not be envious of the wicked or desire to be in their company.
For their hearts scheme of violence, and their lips speak only of mischief.
By wisdom a house is built; by understanding it is made secure.
By knowledge its rooms are filled with rare and desirable riches of all kinds.
A wise man is mightier than a strong man, and a man of knowledge prevails over one who has strength.
For you wage war by wise guidance, and victory depends on a host of counselors.
Wisdom is too lofty for a fool; at the city gate he does not open his mouth.[b]
Anyone who plans to do evil earns a reputation for intrigue.
The intrigues of fools are sinful,[c] and men find the scoffer abhorrent.
If you lose heart in time of adversity, your strength will indeed be limited.
[d]Rescue those who are being led away to death and save those who are on their way to execution.
If you say, “I do not know this man,” will he who tests the heart not perceive it? He who is the guardian of your soul knows it, and he will repay you as your deeds deserve.
Eat honey,[e] my son, for it is good, and the drippings of the honeycomb are sweet to the taste.
In much the same manner will wisdom be sweet to your soul. If you find it, you will have a future, and your hope[f] will not be cut off.
Do not lie in wait at the home of a righteous man; do not raid his dwelling.
For a righteous man falls seven times[g] and rises again, but the wicked stumble into calamity.
Do not be glad when your enemy falls; when he stumbles, do not let your heart exult,
for fear that the LORD will be displeased at the sight and withdraw his wrath from your enemy.
Do not become outraged about evildoers or be envious of the wicked.[h]
For they will have no tomorrow; the lamp of the wicked will be extinguished.
My son, fear the LORD and fear the king;[i] avoid those who rebel against them.
For disaster will strike them suddenly, and who knows what ruin will afflict them and their friends?[j]
[l]These also are sayings of the wise: To show partiality in judgment is an invidious act.
Whoever says to the wicked, “You are innocent,” will be cursed by peoples and denounced by nations.
But those who convict the evildoer will fare well, and they will be blessed with prosperity.
Anyone who offers an honest answer gives a kiss on the lips.
Plan what you want outside and make everything ready on the land; once you have done this, you can go forth and build your house.
Never be a witness against your neighbor without good reason or deceive with your lips.
Never say, “I will do to him as he has done to me; I will pay him back for what he has done.”
I passed by the field of a lazy idler,[n] by the vineyard of a man without sense.
I saw that it was completely overgrown with thorns; the ground was covered with weeds, and its stone wall was broken down.
And as I gazed at it and reflected, I drew this lesson from the sight:
a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the arms to rest,
and poverty will come upon you like a thief, and want will assail you like an armed warrior.
